file_content.text: Lord Trok's life of crime is over.
The pawns have been eliminated from play, Officer Manus. You know what comes next.
Officer Manus--I've brought you one of Lord Trok's associates.
Officer Manus, I presume. What is this madness about a Sith Lord turning common criminal?
Lord Trok is dead.
The size of Lord Trok's syndicate has been reduced by one.
Opted for mercy, I see. Very well. Perhaps I'll have her sent to the Sith Academy for reeducation--if they do that sort of thing.
A vile corruption, permanently removed from under the Empire's skin. Exhilarating, isn't it?
I suppose we could use this one to test the efficacy of our interrogation probes. Fine work, as expected.
Excellent work. Not that I ever had any doubt, of course.
You must be Officer Manus. Do I understand this contract of yours correctly? A Sith Lord is running rackets?
I know it sounds ludicrous on its surface, but please hear me out.
Lord Trok's extremely ambitious, even for a Sith. I know; I used to work with her regularly.
Somewhere along the way, her thirst for power became out-and-out greed. She overthrew a prominent crime syndicate on Nar Shaddaa, transplanting their lieutenants here.
I'll handle these lieutenants.
Leave them to me.
Never mind the help. I want this errant Sith Lord to face me--now.
I want Trok dead.
You weren't appointed by the Empire to deal with Lord Trok. Where do your credits come from?
How are you paying for this?
Of that I have no doubt.
You're a contractor? I mean no disrespect, but clearly, your kind are capable of all manner of surprises.
As I cannot convince anyone of Lord Trok's guilt, I've had to create a special fund for "extraordinary circumstances".
They'll wish they never set foot on Dromund Kaas--and then they'll be dead.
I'll gladly take their lives.
Understandable; however, Lord Trok won't be drawn out unless she feels her operations are in jeopardy.
A suitable outcome, to be sure.
Take care of these outsiders who would dare thumb their noses at the Empire's absolute power, and I'll see to it that you're properly compensated.
Your payment, and my gratitude.
The scrubs are taken care of, Manus. How about we discuss their boss's fate?
Yes. Lord Trok. Any lieutenants still standing in your wake have been wiped out by her, she's so angry.
Trok's reckless now, leaving herself open to attack--but that doesn't make her vulnerable.
Take note of her location, and use it well. I'm quite looking forward to the end of Lord Trok's reign of foolishness.
As much as I'd like to, I cannot offer an official commendation. I do hope my honoring the terms of our contract will suffice.
